results.title: Home
results.creator_credit: Zephlyn Neilsen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Going, going, still here!
results.creator_credit: Garry Hammer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Garry Hammer and his family battle the Gippsland bushfires to save their home.
Garry’s story is a personal account of the fire front that swept through his property, creating its own weather, a life-threatening yet positive force that ultimately gave him a new perspective on his life and his relationship with his son.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Hammer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description:

Garry’s story is a personal account of the fire front that swept through his property, creating its own weather, a life-threatening yet positive force that ultimately gave him a new perspective on his life and his relationship with his son.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.

results.title: Vine grafting
results.brief_description: Deals with several methods of cutting and grafting for production of Phylloxera resistant grapevine canes in the north of Victoria. The film shows the activities of the staff of the Rutherglen research station inside the sheds and in the field, planting and propagating the canes.
results.description: Deals with several methods of cutting and grafting for production of Phylloxera resistant grapevine canes in the north of Victoria. The film shows the activities of the staff of the Rutherglen research station inside the sheds and in the field, planting and propagating the canes.

results.title: The Burning question
results.creator_credit: David Guy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When David moved from the city, he fulfilled a lifetime dream to live in a place he had always visited and dreamed of owning. Losing almost all of his property, he is faced with a burning question in this first-hand account of the devastating Gippsland bushfires.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Guy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description:

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.

results.title: Floods through fire
results.creator_credit: Lynda Code, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lynda Code recalls the hardships of living through the Gippsland bushfires then having to cope with devastating floods. Her story of resiliance is a tribute to her family, who have battled along with her. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynda Code, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

Gabrielle recounts her struggle to gain independence, aided by the love and support of her mother and eight siblings.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.

results.title: Weekends in the country
results.brief_description: Born in the country but forced to live in a hostel for the deaf in Melbourne from a very young age, William talks about his isolation, depression and separation from family. This is a tragic story reflecting the lack of facilities and support for the deaf in rural Victoria. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: Flame within
results.brief_description: A silent film consisting of a montage of images of family, friends, childhood and home juxtaposed to the words passion, freedom and home - each word with its meaning defined in text.
